question.text: Which of the following describes out-crossing?

options.text: Mating of more closely related individuals within the same breed for 4- 6 generations.
This is the practice of mating of animals within the same breed, but having no common ancestors on either side of their pedigree up to 4-6 generations.
Superior males of one breed are mated with superior females of another breed (of same species).
Male and female animals of two different species are mated.

solution.text:
Types of Out-breeding:
A. Out-crossing - Breeding between the unrelated animals, which may be of the same breed but having no common ancestors on either side of their pedigree for 4-6 generations. The offspring of such a mating is known as anout-cross.

B. Cross-breeding - Breeding of animals of different breeds of the same species.
Example: Hisardale is a new breed of sheep developed in Punjab by crossing Bikaneri ewes and Marino rams.

C. Interspecific hybridization - Breeding of animals of different species.
Example: Mule
